name: The Johannesburg Convention
description: The foul capitalists have been vanquished and a worker's South Africa has been born. It is time we gather at the heart of the revolution: the city of Johannesburg, where the proletariat has long been toiling, to decide our future. A future that belongs to us!

name: Abolish Formal Segregation
description: Long have the capitalists-imperialists been using simplistic racial rhetoric to convince the white proletarian that his black comrade would be his adversary, allowing them to entrench their own interests and falsifying a sense of need for collaboration by the white worker. It is time we abolish the legislation designed to keep us in their hands.

name: Herald Syndicate Autonomy
description: While the common catchphrase 'Workers of the world unite!' seems incompatible with the notion of treating certain workers differently from others, the basis of our state are the trade unions, and some of those trade unions want to reserve access to their membership. It is not our place to intervene in that.

name: The La Guma Administration
description: As had been assessed long ago, the white proletariat has shown its true colours: they have developed a bourgeois sense of superiority, and their 'revolution' unsurprisingly proved to be a farce. It has been long overdue that we cut the English and Dutch out of the government. South Africa for South AFRICANS!

name: Land Restitution
description: The colonisers have driven the South Africans from their land, confining them to a wholly unfulfilling 8% of South African soil, forcing our people into famine and overpopulation in a nation that is more than large enough for our people. We shall take back what was stolen from us, and give it back to the people!

name: Native Empowerment Program
description: The whites, ever anxious to lose their position, have spent their time limiting access to education and training to themselves, leaving us to scrub the floor clean. Unfortunately, this means all the technical expertise is with them. A combination of educational reform and hiring educated blacks over whites shall allow us to take back our destiny!

name: The Native Republic
description: With the sweeping reforms enacted by La Guma's government, South Africa once again belongs to the South African people, rather than a minority of Europeans pretending a South African identity who lord us around. The Native Republic, belonging to the black South African, is finally a fact.

name: Outlaw Colour Bars
description: Colour Bars, meant to prevent cheaper black workers from replacing white workers, are an outdated concept now. Every South African is a brother to one another in our move towards socialism and the vile profit motive has been quashed. Such discriminatory measures are nothing but shameful and can't be left in place.

name: Restrict Internal Migration
description: As much as we reject the racially based pass laws of the minority regime, one cannot deny the reality that without any restrictions rural South Africans would swarm Cape Town, Johannesburg and Durban, overpopulating the townships and living in squalor. It is simply a necessity to control the migration flow, even if it need not be racially based.

name: An End to all Pass Laws
description: The pass laws of the minority regime have left scars that may never heal on the South African psyche, pushing the vast majority of South Africans away except if they were needed to do the existing inhabitants' dirty work. While it is likely that the abolition of these laws will attract many rural South Africans to the cities in hopes to find opportunity, this move is non-negotiable.

name: Urban Housing Expansion
description: Our loosening of migration restrictions on urban areas has, as could be expected, resulted in a giant inflow from South Africa's less developed rural areas of South Africans looking for new opportunities. Unfortunately our housing facilities can't keep up to the demand and the new migrants live in squalor as a result. The only option left is to build more housing facilities, and building them fast.

name: Diversify Higher Education
description: Traditionally our institutions of higher education have been quite hostile to non-white students, preferring to gate themselves off and leaving non-whites little choice but to go to less prestigious education facilities. Now that we are creating a new and more fair South Africa, it is time we motivate our institutions of higher education to make their student base more representative to all South Africa.

name: The Revolution in Practice
description: The capitalists have been vanquished, but South Africa has not yet been transformed. Today our work begins to change South Africa for once and for all. The dreadful capitalist system must be rooted out thoroughly and from the ground up we can pave the road to the socialist utopia together!

name: Curtail Reactionary Activity
description: Our enemies are many still: Afrikaner Nationalists are trying to lure our Afrikaner worker base into treason by appealing to their skin complexion. Canada and the exiles from the previous government are plotting a monarchist restoration. Tribal chiefs want to preserve their way of life contrary to our values. We need to suppress them all.

name: Reform the South African Police
description: The South African Police has been a strong tool for the previous regime to keep their hold on our nation and to oppress the worker. It is imperative that we reform this rotten institution from the bottom up so that the police force shall defend the population, rather than keep them down.

name: Seize Control over the Narrative
description: The media is the key to the heart of the people. By assuming control over broadcasting institutions throughout South Africa and filtering the capitalist nonsense inserted by partisan journalists out we can ensure that our population will not be seduced by imperialist lies any longer.

name: Seize Our Industrial Capital
description: Since the discovery of natural resources in the rand and the western Cape, South Africa has steadily grown into possibly the lone industrial state in Africa. Unfortunately, South Africans never benefited from it. British men in high hats reaped the benefits of the labour of South Africans and gave us a hunger wage. Not anymore: South African industry will benefit South Africans.

name: Tolerate Small Farming Enterprises
description: While nothing but our wrath shall be directed to the corporations attempting to monopolise the most precious tenet of a civilisation: the food supply, it would not be fair to deprive small family businesses of their livelihood on this basis. While in a very banal way it does resemble capitalism if one works their land and sells the returns for a tidy profit, on a small scale it is acceptable.

name: Nationalize Our Agrarian Potential
description: Capitalists have taken our farmlands for themselves and sell food, the most fundamental need of the human being, for profit. It is time we collectivise the agrarian sector, reorganising it into farming cooperatives, in which each farmer works. This will ensure it will stay a fair profession.

name: Appropriate the Mines
description: South Africa's soil is rich: diamonds, gold, coal... It can all be found right there under our feet. But unfortunately, Rhodes and his successors have taken control over them, forcing miners to shed blood, sweat and tears exhuming diamonds for an extremely low wage while they sell them to jewelries in Ottawa for exorbitantly high prices where tea-sipping aristocrats happily wear them. No longer!

name: Divide the Spoils of Class War
description: We have spent our time taking what rightfully belongs to the South African from the international capitalist. Of course, there is pain involved in this business. But now that the wealth has flowed into our hands, we can return it to the people, who shall thrive with it!

name: I See You!
description: Industrial and Commercial Workers' Union, ICU for short - correctly assessed by a white judge to be pronounced as 'I see you'. The black South African did see the white South African, when he was denied access to sidewalks, beaches and jobs by him. And now, through the ICU's action, for perhaps the first time, the white South African sees him too...

name: Organize Native Unions
description: The black population of South Africa is too a much lesser degree involved in trade unionism. Where the whites have been involved in it for a long time, black trade unions were suppressed and otherwise had trouble organising their work force. Now, with government support, we can change this.

name: Inspire Communal Engagement
description: Small, often traditionalist communities, are not very inclined to involve themselves into the affairs of the state. But now we are a pluralist nation and we value the engagement of our citizens, so we should work with them to engage them.

name: Native Education Program
description: Any and all public education in South Africa had been reserved to whites during the previous regime, relegating black South Africans to the goodwill of missionaries and religious institutions. While the quality was passable, it was unsurprisingly riddled with religiosity, the tool to keep the proletariat in line, too. It is time we open up objective education for non-whites.

name: Incorporate the SAIC
description: To fully ensure the cooperation with the Indian community in South Africa, it is paramount that we incorporate their interest group, the South African Indian Congress, into the government like we did with the Industrial and Commercial Workers' Union.

name: Support the SAIC
description: While incorporation is perhaps a bit too extreme for such a small diaspora, the South African Indian Congress are the most significant interest group for the Indian South African community. It is important that we support their efforts.

name: Inclusive Participation Doctrine
description: If we are to succeed as a truly fair and equal nation, we need every racial group to participate. For this reason we have the Inclusive Participation Doctrine: by engaging with our communities and special programs, we can ensure that we are not a government of compassionate whites and black intellectuals while the rest of South Africa is apathetic.

name: The Durban Convention
description: We have made tremendous strides in the last few years: the Larneys have been crushed, racial affairs have been made more equitable and South Africa for perhaps the first time since the concept exists, belongs to the South African. Still, there is more work to be done as we pave our road to socialism; and part of that is participation of the public.

name: Dethrone the Paramount Chiefs
description: The Paramount Chiefs represent the kowtowing of the native population to the Imperialist and the corruption it imparts. They must be "dethroned" , with committees formed for greater representation

name: Found the Bechuanaland Election Committee
description: With the Paramount Chiefs removed, we must now move to establish a true form of representation for the inhabitants of Bechuanaland. By setting up BEC's in the settlement dotted throughout the region, we can ensure the Tswana can properly voice their concerns in the South African government.

name: Annex Basutoland and Swaziland
description: Basutoland and Swaziland are quite small, and putting an end to the tribal structures is relatively easy as such. By integrating them in their neighbouring provinces of Eastern Cape and Natal we can assure their continued prosperity as South Africans.

name: Political Development in the Protectorates
description: 20th century politics in the protectorates is far and few between. To some degree these provinces are still under the tribal authorities from which all mankind stems eventually. Unfortunately, this state of affairs is much less equitable than our socialist system. Through education, we can change this state of affairs.

name: Establish Bechuanaland Autonomous Commune
description: Even if it was beholden to the Paramount Chiefs, the Tswana people have had autonomy over their own affairs since times immemorial, even under British administration. It would not be equitable to deprive them of this, thus the Bechuanaland Autonomous Commune is being drafted, which has the right to pass its own laws devolved from our national government.

name: Extend Citizenship to the Swazi and Sotho
description: Now that we have integrated their homeland into our nation, it seems straightforward that the Sotho and Swazi that live there should be extended a South African passport. They'd  be stateless on their own land otherwise.

name: Ethnic Representation Councils
description: Not only the former High Commissioner Territories, but South Africa as a whole is divided by several ethnicities, like the Xhosa, the Zulu and the Ndebele. To ensure the interests of these group are fairly represented, we should establish Ethnic Representation Councils elected by members of those ethnic groups.

name: Develop the Borderlands
description: The outer layer of South Africa, Bechuanaland and Southern Rhodesia, were much less settled by Europeans and as such not nearly as much developed by them. It is time we redirect some funds to ensure the borderlands adhere to the same standards as inner South Africa, although this will not be easy or cheap. They are South Africans too!

name: Communal Defence Auxiliaries
description: By arming the inhabitants of the (former) protectorates, we can increase the fighting power of our military. Where the racists constantly tried to limit their arms to the Assegai, we shall deliver real guns for those willing to fight for South Africa.

name: Complete the Integration
description: It has been hard work, but the protectorates are now administrative equals to the rest of our nation, and can no longer be denied to be as much South Africa as Cape Town or Johannesburg.

name: Join the Phalanstére
description: To join the Phalanstére, will allow our brightest and best access to the cutting edge of Syndicalist ideals, and technology to further promote syndicalist ideals within South Africa.

name: Focus on Agricultural Expansion
description: South Africa is a bountiful land, with rich, fertile soil. We must expand upon this, and ensure that regardless of colour, that a man can work for his bread.

name: Agrarian Socialism
description: With the previous system of farming in South Africa hailing from the old imperialistic system now no more, we will promote racial harmony with socialist ideals and will remove those who go against us.

name: Support Cape Wineries
description: The Mediterranean climate of the Cape is perfect for the cultivation of wine grapes, and as such, South African wine is world-renowned. We should make use of this export boon, and support our wineries in their endeavours.

name: Establish National Farming Cooperatives
description: With the removal of Imperialist and Nationalist organisations, the people of all colours are now able to work the land. Under our guidance, we shall form farming cooperatives of mixed race, to further ease racial tensions, and promote syndicalist ideals.

name: Agricultural Innovation
description: As our brothers and sisters work the land, we must obtain further techniques to further innovate our agricultural sector.

name: Aid Small Farming Communities
description: Not all farming communities within South Africa are large, due to population settlement, and the crops being grown. With this, an initiative has been created to aid these communities, to promote growth of these communities and to ensure there is a level of diversity in our crops.

name: Industrial Farming Equipment
description: The tractor, the plough, and the sickle, are but few of the needs that are required if we are to revolutionise our farming industry.

name: The Granary of Africa
description: Our agricultural achievements have not gone without notice: South African bread is exported through the continent and beyond, feeding colonist and colonial alike. As such, South Africa is quickly becoming known as the Granary of Africa.

name: South Africa's Gold
description: South Africa has significant gold reserves. The presence of gold means we have the means to back up our currency and it's something other countries desire for a similar goal. It would be foolish not to exploit the money that lies below our soil.

name: Focus on Industrial Expansion
description: If we are to spread syndicalism throughout Africa, we must secure an industrial base and expand upon in.

name: Manufacturing Expansion Plan
description: With great care, and planning, our civil engineers have laid out great plans for our largest cities.

name: Form the IDC of South Africa
description: The Industrial Development Cooperative of South Africa will become a financial institution aiding South Africa's industrial development through the distribution of grants to build certain required industries and contribute to our economic growth, allowing our industry to grow.

name: Recruit Native Labour
description: For too long the Natives of this great land have been forced to into the role of a servitor. No more, they shall now be employed to work in our ever expanding industries.

name: The Great Repairshop
description: Our industry has rapidly evolved over the last years to enable us to properly support a long-term war effort. This has been so successful that by now, South Africa is known as the 'Great Repairshop', where our allies' equipment in North Africa, the Middle East and Southern Europe goes when it needs repairing.

name: Support the Metalworker's Union
description: The Metalworker's Union was formed to ensuring the rights of the worker were protected by the Imperialist and their greedy needs. We should support this movement, and ensure it is promoting syndicalist ideals.

name: Expand the Rand Steelworks
description: With the Metalworker's Union now firmly influenced by the party, we can see to expanding the newly "liberated" steelwork industries within South Africa.

name: Industrial Innovation
description: As we push further with industrial expansion, we must secure the means of innovation to ensure we are on the bleeding edge of industrial technology.

name: Socialist Prosperity
description: Though blood,sweet and tears, we have secured a level of prosperity in South Africa that would never been reached if the Imperialists or the Nationalist agendas were not removed. We have truly \"broken the chains\".

name: The Great Purge
description: The South African armed forces were created by the odd marriage between imperialist English and Afrikaner exploiters. A complete purge is required to ensure no elements of the old order remains and that South Africans can truly break their chains!

name: Repeal Racist Reforms
description: Currently, the South African armed forces is riddled with reforms designed to keep non-whites from ever advancing higher then a non commission officer and that they aren't allowed to order white soldiers, unless permission is given to them by a white Officer. These reforms must be repealed at once.

name: Abolish Commissions
description: A traditional harking back to days of the Imperialist in the United Kingdom, one could merely buy his way into rank opposed to earning it by merit. The new South African armed forces will no longer have the bourgeoisie buy there way into society, it must be earned through merit and via a vote of ones peers.Though this more of a means for the Government to remove those they deem a threat to the cause.

name: Third Internationale Advisors
description: With the South African armed forces being reformed from the bottom up, it is in desperate need for guidance from those inlined with the new syndicalist government with it reaching out to members of the Third Internationale for such guidance.

name: Third Internationale Provisions
description: The South African armed forces are lacking the basic necessities to support itself. Our generous comrades have provided us these means and appear willing to support us in these turbulent times.

name: English Arms Development
description: The South African arms industry is more or less still based on now dubbed "Canadian" arms for political reasons. This has allowed for "English" arms development to easily take over these existing industries and assist South Africa gain a level of self reliance.

name: Establish Local Arms Unions
description: With the recent development of "English" arms within South Africa, it has become apparent that South Africa is the lone syndicalist outpost in Africa and needs to maintain a level of self reliance regarding it's arm industry. With this unions have been formed to establish it's own local arms industries to produce the means of war.

name: Establish a Syndicalist Navy
description: With the help of British Navy advisors, the South African navy has began the process of reforming itself into a model more befitting a member of the Third Internationale.

name: Destroyer Effort
description: With the latest Destroyer designs now made available to the South African Navy from the Union of Britian, has allowed them to standardise itself to that of the Third Internationale.

name: Red Merchant Navy
description: With South Africa still attempting to establish the means to produce and become more self-reliant, a merchant navy has become required to ensure that goods, weapons and other necessities can shipped into the country.

name: Cruiser Effort
description: Further efforts have been made to obtain larger ship designs for the South African Navy. These cruiser designs that will fill in the niche that the Navy requires to provide greater protection of South Africa's shores.

name: Develop South African Shipyards
description: Expansion of the lacklustre naval facilities of Port Elizabeth and Cape Town, will allow for local development and production of maritime vessels for the South African Navy.

name: Coastal Guard Union
description: South Africa has a large coast line that is dotted with several major ports and cities. These vital ports need to be defended with plans drawn from the old administration with the creation of a Coastal Guard Union. This union is to be filled by men and women who are unsuited for the front lines, but are ideal for manning the guns of the coast.

name: French Commune Advisors
description: With a large distrust still towards the British, the Government has turned to the Commune of France to assist them in reform their Army and eagerly await for their 'Camarades de France' to arrive.

name: Commune of France Investment
description: The French have insisted that further industrial development to be allowed within South Africa in order to allow for the South African army. Though the French appear to be eager to accept most of the cost, fears of a new wave of "colonialism" have rippled through South Africa, with members of the Government putting minds at ease with more jobs becoming available.

name: 'Camarades' Officer
description: The Camarades have began to retrain our newly voted-in Officer Corps in the tactics of "Guerre de Mouvement" - War of Movement. This involves the promotion of using armoured units to breakthrough the enemy lines and exploit the enemies flanks. Perfect warfare, it appears, for the large desert of North Africa.

name: African Red Vanguard
description: Further indoctrination of the South African army by the Camarades has lead to a push for South Africa to be the vanguard of the syndicalism in Africa. Cries are getting louder and louder for the South Africa to break the chains on their African brethren within Mittelafrika and Northern Africa and paint the map of Africa red.

name: Form the Parabat
description: The \"Parabat\", the combining of the words "Parachute Battalion" is a local initiative to have infantry dropped behind enemy lines and strike the enemies rear. Further to this, the aims of the battalion is to supply syndicalist-aligned forces within Africa to further the cause.

name: South African Support Crews
description: The harshness of South Africa has been a strain on the French designed tanks that have been supplied and built under license. Lacking the expertise to make real modifications to these tanks, support crews have been assigned to keep these tanks running.

name: Tanks from the Commune
description: Tank designs from the Commune of France have been adapted by our local engineers to ensure they can survive the rigorous terrain that our homeland brings. Though this has come at some cost, it's benefits outweigh this greatly and will surely continue return itself in investment.

name: Guerre de Mouvement
description: After several long hard months, the South African Army has been reborn. Gone are the racist and imperialistic goals, which have been now replaced with the drive to liberate Africa under the iron treats of South African Tanks!

name: South Africa Stands Ready
description: South Africa stands ready for the next great struggle against those who would seek to chain them with their bourgeoisie views and Imperialistic goals. Whether the next war takes South Africa to the vast deserts of North Africa or the green fields of Germany, it stands ready and able to fight. Break the Chains!!!

name: Advisors from Aeronautica Rossa
description: The Socialist Republic of Italy is the younger brother of the Third Internationale, with it, like South Africa, still finding its place within the organisation. They have provided several aviation instructors to help South Africa reform its air force.

name: The Red Gift
description: The Socialist Republic of Italy has parted to South Africa a large quantity of aeroplane models to the South African Air Force. Though these models are old, they are still capable aircraft and will provide the nucleus of South Africa's new red air force.

name: New Pilot Cadre
description: The advisors from the Socialist Republic of Italy have proven invaluable to our efforts. These efforts have yielded a cadre of fresh, eager Pilots who will be the new generation of the South African air force.

name: Close Air Support Designs
description: The terrain of South Africa is vast and varied, with desert, bush and lush overgrowth being but a few of the terrain types within it's borders. With the introduction of new Close Air Support models from the Third Internationale, has allowed for our air force to provide greater ground support to our ground forces.

name: Listening Post
description: The old saying 'Knowledge is power' is fitting for the situation that South Africa faces. With several possible enemies to the north, South Africa must know what they are up to react appropriately.

name: Military Research Initiatives
description: The South African armed forces can not overly relay on research and development from the Third Internationale. It must be able to take it's own measure in these fields and promote the development of these fields.

name: The Men from R.E.D
description: R.E.D short for 'Revolutionary Exportation Directory' have provided several advisors to help guide our newly formed South African army. Though many still distrust the \"English\", the Government hopes these men will mend that rift caused by centuries of strife and move South Africa forward.

name: Reform the Militia
description: Currently South Africa has many men under arms, but no real direction for them. They are currently made of all walks of life and in most part are united under the flag of syndicalism. R.E.D advisors wish to amalgamate these forces into a single cohesive force and for them to form the backbone of the new South African army.

name: British Arms
description: British arms have begun to flood our ports, as R.E.D advisors have begun their process of reshaping the South African army in order to bring a level centralisation.

name: British Officer Model
description: The R.E.D advisors have begun training the next generation of South African officers. Focusing on small unit tactics, with the use of armour and artillery to overwhelm an enemy position. These tactics will prove useful on the battlefield and provide a level of professionalism our army currently lacks.

name: South African Red Guard
description: Red Guard units have been designed to be made of veterans within the South African army and those more 'dedicated' to syndicalism. They are provided better equipment and training compared to their Militia brethren. Though in theory, Militia formations can be 'promoted' to a Red Guard formation, though this appears to be more political based then merit...

name: British Armour Designs
description: Tanks are the modern cavalry of the battlefield, with current doctrine being that they provide support to infantry and assist in breakthoughs. This may change in time, but the current models generously provided by the Union of Britain will greatly assist South Africa adopting to this doctrine.

name: R.E.D Doctrine Entrenched
description: With the doctrine provided by R.E.D well and truly entrenched, the South African Army is ready to carry the torch of syndicalism into the heart of darkness of Africa!

name: Red Marines
description: R.E.D advisors have provided the training and means for a South African marine force to be created. The concept of this formation is to secure beach heads and hold them long enough for larger Militia and Red Guard units to punch through. With Africa and even Europe dotted with important ports, these marines will proof vital in the war too come.
